description:
schizo- +‎ -thymia
From Ancient Greek σχῐ́ζω (skhízō, “to split”) + θῡμός (thūmós, “temper, disposition”). Compare cyclothymia.

entries.meaning: (psychiatry) A temperament characterised by elements of schizophrenia or schizoid personality disorder, while still within the bounds of normality.
